channel.title: Compiler Problem!
channel.description: here's the problem and I don't know how to fix :) Is says Javac is not a regconized command. [IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/1hw3z8.jpg[/img] Any help is appreciated, Thanks :D

item.title: Compiler Problem!
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

Download JDK from here: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html

Choose your Operating System. You should be installing JDK 6 Update 26.

Replace your old code in your compile with this code (If you have Windows 32):

@echo off title Compile "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

Replace your old code in your compile with this code (If you have Windows 64):

@echo off title Compile "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

[hr]

If this doesn’t work, which it probably won’t, you need to set up your environmental variables. Check out my epic tutorial, or another person’s:

Go to [size=14pt]Start[/size]

Right click [size=14pt]Computer[/size], Then click properties [size=14pt]Properties [/size]

Underneath tasks you will find [size=14pt]Advanced/Advanced system settings [/size] click on that

Click [size=14pt]Environmental Variables[/size]

Click New for underneath the [size=14pt]user variables[/size]

Make variable name [size=18pt]Path[/size]. For value put: C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin; REMEMBER TO REPLACE THE 20 WITH THE VERSION YOU HAVE! ERASE THE (x86) IF YOU HAVE 32-BIT

Now make another variable called [size=18pt]Classpath[/size], put the name CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin;%CLASSPATH%;. REMEMBER TO REPLACE THE 20 WITH THE VERISON OF JAVA YOU HAVE! ERASE THE (x86) IF YOU HAVE 32-BIT

You have made Environmental Variables. Hope this helped

Read full topic

if it dont open up in notepad browse and open in notepad, once you have got it open in notepad copy and paste the contents in to a reply
